SENT.plain: A case of unilateral XIIth nerve palsy due to the dissection of the internal carotid artery is reported
The clinical and radiological features are described
In this patient, cranial nerve palsy is probably the result of compression by an enlarging carotid artery due to mural hematoma
Diagnosis is discussed with emphasis on magnetic resonance imaging findings
Magnetic resonance imaging is also useful for follow-up of arterial lesions
